frame.name: Giving_in
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Capitulator</fen> who has been opposing a <fen>Force</fen>, which is typically exerted by a <fen>Compeller</fen>, ceases opposing that <fen>Force</fen>. As a result, the <fen>Force</fen> runs its course and an <fen>Issue</fen> is resolved against the interests of the <fen>Capitulator</fen>.
<ex>Accordingly, there is no basis to conclude that <fex name="Capitulator">Tazewell</fex> <t>acquiesced</t> <fex name="Force">in the rule against claim-splitting</fex>.</ex> <ex>Accordingly, there is no basis to conclude that Tazewell <t>acquiesced</t> in the rule against <fex name="Issue">claim-splitting</fex>.</ex>
<ex>My uncle continued trying to placate Nuayman until <fex name="Capitulator">the latter</fex> <t>relented</t>. <fex name="Issue">DNI</fex> <fex name="Force">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex> <fex name="Capitulator">Genesis</fex> <t>acquiesced</t> <fex name="Resultant_action">to doing a short Q and A session</fex>. <fex name="Force">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="Capitulator">The government</fex> would not <t>yield</t> <fex name="Force">to pressure</fex> , the spokeswoman promised . <fex name="Issue">DNI</fex></ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Capitulator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual that yields to the <fen>Force</fen> exerted by the <fen>Compeller</fen>.
<ex>I sensed that if <fex name="cap">John</fex> <t>caved in</t> to her that it would hurt his game.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Issue
FE.definition:
<def-root>The matter, usually concerning a course of action, in which the <fen>Capitulator</fen> has disagreed with the <fen>Compeller</fen>.
<ex>Historically, the Senate has <t>yielded</t> to the House <fex name="iss">on the issue</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Compeller
FE.definition:
<def-root>An individual that intentionally exerts <fen>Force</fen> on the <fen>Capitulator</fen>.
<ex>Relatively new to business, poor Kellie had eventually <t>caved in</t> <fex name="com">to him</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time period during which the <fen>Capitulator</fen> yields to the <fen>Compeller</fen> on the <fen>Issue</fen>.
<ex>Ms Marinkovic <t>relented</t> <fex name="tim">yesterday</fex> under intense international pressure.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is a proposition denoting a state of affairs from which the <fen>Capitulator</fen>'s giving in on the <fen>Issue</fen> logically follows.
<ex>I <t>yielded</t> to him <fex name="exp">because I wanted to be a team player</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Force
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs, typically brought about by a <fen>Compeller</fen>, that impinges on the <fen>Capitulator</fen> and eventually causes them to no longer pursue their own view on the <fen>Issue</fen>.
<ex>In 1649, Descartes <t>yielded</t> <fex name="for">to the request of Queen Christina of Sweden that he join her distinguished circle she was assembling in Stockholm</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the <fen>Capitulator</fen> ceases to oppose the <fen>Force</fen>.
<ex>John refused to heed the barons? early calls for reform, but in June 1215 he <t>capitulated</t> <fex name="pla">at Runnymede</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root> An action that the <fen>Capitulator</fen> intends to accomplish by ceasing their opposition.
<ex> Corfu in 229 BC, after several raids and suzerainties, was forced to ask the protection of the Romans and finally <t>yielded</t> to them <fex name="pur">in order to protect itself</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the Giving_in which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Capitulator that affect the action (<ment>reluctantly</ment>, <ment>meekly</ment>).
<ex>Congress <fex name="man">reluctantly</fex> <t>capitulated</t> to this final demand on Sept. 1.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>A modifier expressing the deviation of how the <fen>Issue</fen> is resolved from the desires of the <fen>Compeller</fen>.
<ex>She <fex name="deg">partially</fex> <t>gave in</t>, admitting her anti-urban bias was mostly in part to her parents brainwashing her from a young age.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Resultant_action
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action that the <fen>Capitulator</fen> engages in after giving in to the <fen>Force</fen>.
<ex>After months of pressure by my staff, I have finally <t>yielded</t> <fex name="Resultant_action">to doing a commentary on advertising</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: relent.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: abandon or mitigate a harsh intention or cruel treatment.

lexUnit.name: acquiesce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: accept or consent to something without protest

lexUnit.name: yield.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give way to demands or pressure; submit.

lexUnit.name: capitulate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cease to resist an opponent or an unwelcome demand; surrender.

lexUnit.name: fold [to demands].v
lexUnit.definition: FN: A Capitulator agrees to the Compeller's Issue. Implies a strong desire not to do so, moreso than for "yield", for example.

lexUnit.name: submit.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to accept or obey the authority of another person or group "After the defeat of their navy, they had to submit to Roman rule."
